column2: With the end of imperial rule in our realm, our connection with the rest of the Latin world has been severed, causing localities to establish their own local rites and customs. The local population in [Root.Location.GetName] has diverged so far from the traditional Roman way of life that they can neither command the Latin tongue nor be considered Roman: They are now Italan.

As the migration era begins to come to a close, much has changed in the world: allegiances have shifted, settlements have been abandoned, people have been uprooted, and connection to the old ways has been severed. This has become particularly appearent in [Root.Location.GetName], where the old Suebi identity is all but extinguished: They are now German.

Since it's conquest, the Saxons in [Root.Location.GetName] have completely subdued and supplanted the prior inhabitants. However, after many years of living away from their homeland, changes in customs and speech are starting to become apparent, so much so that those living in [Root.Location.GetName] can no longer be seen as true Saxons: They are now Anglo-Saxon.

As the dark ages begin to come to a close, much has changed in the world, particularly in [Root.Location.GetName]. Without a strong Saxon emperor to unite them, the old rites there have irreversibly diverged and diminished, to give rise to a new identity: They are now Frisian.

As the dark ages begin to come to a close, much has changed in the world, particularly in [Root.Location.GetName]. Without a strong Frankish emperor to unite them, the old rites there have irreversibly diverged and diminished, to give rise to a new identity: They are now Dutch.

With the end of imperial rule in our realm, our connection with the rest of the Punic world has been severed, causing localities to establish their own local rites and customs. The local population in [Root.Location.GetName] has diverged so far from the traditional Carthaginian way of life that they can neither command the Punic tongue nor be considered Carthaginian: They are now Taliaite.
